page.title: 07OYSTER FARMING CONT.
page.content: A total of 6,500 were bought at the following sizes: 1,ooo at 3 gms 5,000 at 20gms 500 at 40gms The idea behind the trial is that the 40gm oysters should be of marketable size in November 1985, the 20gm ones a year later and the 3gm oysters a year after that.So far in the trial this is proving to be correct.The oysters will trade at the same price as a first class stamp (17p). The oysters are kept at approximately 100 to a "Netlon" plastic meshed bag on larch trestles between Tobar na Crubag and Rubha na Feannag and must be graded at Spring tides which is the only time that the oysters are exposed.
